intro: Lesquerella hemiphysaria var. lucens, commonly known as the shining lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique seed oil composition, it has potential applications in industrial and agricultural uses.
